items.title: Kenneth Taylor vertrekt door de voordeur bij Ajax
items.summary: Kenneth Taylor vervolgt zijn loopbaan bij Lazio in de Serie A. Het is een moment waar de 23-jarige middenvelder naar uitkeek, maar tegelijkertijd ook tegenop zag: zijn afscheid bij Ajax. Vijftien en een half jaar lang was het zijn thuis en beleefde hij pieken en dalen. Nu wordt alles anders.

items.title: Wintertransfers Eredivisie seizoen 2025/26: alle clubs op een rij
items.summary: De transferperiode is weer losgebarsten. In dit overzicht van VI vind je alle afgeronde, door clubs bevestigde, wintertransfers van de achttien Eredivisie-clubs. Clubs in Nederland kunnen tot en met 3 februari spelers aantrekken.

items.title: Ajax verkoopt Taylor voor miljoenenbedrag aan Lazio
items.summary: Kenneth Taylor lijkt zijn laatste wedstrijd voor Ajax te hebben gespeeld. De 23-jarige middenvelder, wiens contract in 2027 afloopt, heeft zijn jawoord gegeven aan Lazio. Alleen de medische keuring staat een overstap naar de Serie A-club in de weg.

items.title: I√±igo Mart√≠nez krijgt lachers op zijn hand na vraag over Bar√ßa-terugkeer
items.summary: Dat Barcelona sinds het vertrek van I√±igo Mart√≠nez zoekt naar een centrale verdediger, is een publiek geheim. In die zoektocht zou zelfs de Spanjaard zelf op de lijstjes van de Catalanen zijn verschenen. Helaas voor de topclub, zit een terugkeer er niet in, aldus de verdediger zelf.

items.title: 'Bove maakt transfer om ruim jaar na hartstilstand rentree te kunnen maken'
items.summary: Edoardo Bove staat naar verluidt op het punt om een transfer te maken. De 23-jarige Italiaan kreeg dertien maanden geleden een hartstilstand, maar hoopt spoedig zijn rentree te maken. Aangezien dat niet in Itali√´ kan, lijkt dat bij Watford te moeten gebeuren.

items.title: Villa exploring potential Gallagher signing
items.summary: Aston Villa are exploring the potential to sign Conor Gallagher from Atletico Madrid.

items.summary: Manchester City have announced the signing of Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth.

items.title: Sources: Saka to sign new five-year deal at Arsenal
items.summary: Arsenal have agreed the framework of a new long-term contract with Bukayo Saka, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Interim boss Fletcher in dark over Man Utd plans
items.summary: Darren Fletcher says he's in the dark over Manchester United's plans for his future as he prepares to take charge of his second game as caretaker boss.

Solskjaer to hold talks with Man Utd on Saturday

items.title: ‚ÄòWhy can‚Äôt it be us?‚Äô: Weston-super-Mare hope FA Cup dream run can go on
items.summary: National League South side face Grimsby in the third round and those at the club are desperate for the ride to continue Weeks on from the FA Cup third-round draw, inside Weston-super-Mare‚Äôs modest clubhouse at their stadium a couple of miles from the holiday haven beachfront, there is still a tinge of incredulity at what might have been. Bridget Bolland, operations manager and one of the mini-army of staff who keep the part-time sixth-tier side ticking, relays how, normally, visiting teams have their post-match meal on a bench beside the skittles alley, sausage and chips usually the offering. The thought of Bruno Fernandes or Erling Haaland tucking in here is yet to fully evaporate. But the draw meant Weston, the promotion-chasing National League South side who have reached this stage of the Cup for the first time, have been preparing for a different challenge: a tie at fourth-tier Grimsby Town, who beat Manchester United in the Carabao Cup in August. ‚ÄúAs a United fan, I hated them that night,‚Äù says Weston‚Äôs manager, Scott Rogers. ‚ÄúI was going mad at the TV. But I‚Äôm hoping we can do something similar. There‚Äôs always an upset in the Cup: why can‚Äôt it be us?‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Spurs captain Romero given additional ban after red card
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero is given an additional one-match suspension and fined ¬£50,000 for his behaviour during his side's Premier League defeat to Liverpool last month.

items.title: Football Daily | British managers abroad: will Gary O‚ÄôNeil sink or swim at Strasbourg?
items.summary: Sign up now! Sign up now! Sign up now? Sign up now! Some British managers who have chanced their arm on the continent have won trophies and the adoration of supporters. Others have at least provided the Daily with plenty of content. For every Bobby Robson, there‚Äôs a Tony Adams, or to meet somewhere in the middle, Steve McClaren ‚Äì who can deliver you a league title while still making an arsche of himself in TV interviews. What fate awaits Gary O‚ÄôNeil, quietly ushered into the vacant hot seat at Ligue 1 Strasbourg after Todd Boehly called up Liam Rosenior for the real job? Like Rosenior, he starts his tenure with a tricky away day in the cup; hours before Chelsea play Charlton, O‚ÄôNeil will take the reins for a Coupe de France tie at fourth-tier Avranches. Back on a cold December day in 2001, I sat at Hillsborough and watched in despair as Sheffield Wednesday got absolutely shellacked by Norwich City, losing 5-0 at home. A couple of days after the game I sat down and wrote a letter (ask your parents, kids!) to our manager, Terry Yorath. I wasn‚Äôt rude, just desperate: I said I thought he ought to know that I‚Äôd been watching Wednesday for 17 years and that was the worst I‚Äôd ever seen us play. And you know what: he wrote me an actual letter back. He said he was sorry, that the club valued my support, and that he was trying hard to change things. He didn‚Äôt really change things (though we escaped relegation to League One by a point), but he did care enough to write to me, and I‚Äôve never forgotten that. A gentleman‚Äù ‚Äì Adam Gutteridge. Continue reading...
